ray.rage.rendersystem

Interface Viewport

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Disposable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GL4Viewport

    public interface Viewport
extends Disposable
    A viewport is a 2D rectangle that defines the size of the rendering surface onto which a 3D scene being rendered from a camera's point of view is projected.

    Most of the time, the region occupies the whole surface of the render target, but this does not need to be the case. The viewport can also be a portion, or sub-set, of the target (e.g. split screen multi-player).

    The viewport works as a "connection bridge" across packages. It "connects" the source of an image, provided by a camera, and the target surface onto which the render-system will be drawing this image, specified by a canvas.

    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Viewport.Listener
      Listener interface to notify clients of events affecting viewports.

    • Method Detail

      • addListener

        void addListener(Viewport.Listener vpl)
        Adds a new viewport-listener for events affecting this viewport.
        Parameters:
        vpl - The viewport-listener being added.

      • removeListener

        void removeListener(Viewport.Listener vpl)
        Removes the specified viewport-listener.
        Parameters:
        vpl - The viewport-listener to remove.

      • removeAllListeners

        void removeAllListeners()
        Removes all viewport-listeners currently registered with this viewport.

      • setDimensions

        void setDimensions(float bottom,
                   float left,
                   float width,
                   float height,
                   boolean overrideScissor)
        Sets the coordinates of the viewable area in relative window coordinates.

        This method causes notifyDimensionsChanged() to be invoked.

        Parameters:
        bottom - The lower portion of the viewport.
        left - The left portion of the viewport.
        width - The width of the viewport.
        height - The height of the viewport.
        overrideScissor - True if the values should also be used to define the scissor box. False otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any of the values are outside the [0, 1] range.
        See Also:
        setDimensions(float, float, float, float), setScissors(float, float, float, float), notifyDimensionsChanged()

      • setDimensions

        void setDimensions(float bottom,
                   float left,
                   float width,
                   float height)
        Sets the coordinates of the viewable area in relative window coordinates. This automatically overrides the current scissor values.

        This method causes notifyDimensionsChanged() to be invoked.

        Parameters:
        bottom - The lower portion of the viewport.
        left - The left portion of the viewport.
        width - The width of the viewport.
        height - The height of the viewport.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any of the values are outside the [0, 1] range.
        See Also:
        setDimensions(float, float, float, float, boolean), setScissors(float, float, float, float), notifyDimensionsChanged()

      • setScissors

        void setScissors(float bottom,
                 float left,
                 float width,
                 float height)
        Sets the coordinates of the scissor box in relative window coordinates. The rectangle defined by this box must either be of the same size as the viewport or lie inside of it.

        This method causes notifyDimensionsChanged() to be invoked.

        Parameters:
        bottom - The lower portion of the box.
        left - The left portion of the box.
        width - The width of the box.
        height - The height of the box.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any of the values are outside the [0, 1] range or outside of the viewport dimensions.
        See Also:
        setDimensions(float, float, float, float), setDimensions(float, float, float, float, boolean), notifyDimensionsChanged()

      • notifyDimensionsChanged

        void notifyDimensionsChanged()
        Lets this viewport know that the dimensions of the rendering target have changed. For example, the RenderWindow uses it to inform the viewport that it has been resized, but it's not limited to that use. If the viewport's dimensions are modified directly, then this method is also invoked automatically.

        Any existing viewport-listeners are also notified via Viewport.Listener.onViewportDimensionsChanged(Viewport).

        WARNING: This method is meant to be used internally by the framework and not by game clients. Use directly only if you really know what you're doing.

      • setCamera

        void setCamera(Camera cam)
        Specifies the camera that will be used to render into this viewport.

        This also notifies the camera that a viewport has been assigned to it via Camera.notifyViewport(Viewport), notifies viewport-listeners the camera for this viewport has changed via Viewport.Listener.onViewportCameraChanged(Viewport), and automatically adjusts the camera's aspect ratio if the Camera#getAutoAspectRatio() returns true.

        Parameters:
        cam - The camera that will be rendering the scene through this viewport.

      • getCamera

        Camera getCamera()
        Gets the camera used to render the scene through this viewport, if any. Null otherwise.
        Returns:
        The camera currently assigned to use this viewport.

      • getTarget

        java.awt.Canvas getTarget()
        Gets the target drawing surface this viewport allows cameras to render scenes into.
        Returns:
        The Canvas onto which drawing operations are performed.

      • setClearColor

        void setClearColor(float red,
                   float green,
                   float blue,
                   float alpha)
        Sets the color to use when clearing the background, or color buffer, in the RGBA color space. The final color is produced by interpolating all the components.
        Parameters:
        red - The red component.
        green - The green component.
        blue - The blue component.
        alpha - The value for the alpha component. A value of 1 means its fully opaque and 0 means fully transparent.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any of the values is outside the [0, 1] range.
        See Also:
        setClearColor(Color)

      • setClearColor

        void setClearColor(java.awt.Color c)
        Sets the Color to use when clearing the background, or color buffer, in the sRGB ColorSpace.
        Parameters:
        c - The background Color
        See Also:
        setClearColor(float, float, float, float)

      • getClearColor

        java.awt.Color getClearColor()
        Gets the Color used for clearing the color buffer.
        Returns:
        The Color for the background buffer.
        See Also:
        getClearColorBuffer()

      • getClearColorBuffer

        java.nio.FloatBuffer getClearColorBuffer()
        Gets the value to clear the color buffer as a FloatBuffer.
        Returns:
        A FloatBuffer with the Color for the background buffer.
        See Also:
        getClearColor()

      • setClearDepth

        void setClearDepth(float depth)
        Sets the value to clear the depth buffer.
        Parameters:
        depth - The value to clear the depth buffer.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the value is outside the [0, 1]} range.

      • getClearDepth

        float getClearDepth()
        Gets the value to clear the depth buffer.
        Returns:
        A scalar value within the [0, 1] range.
        See Also:
        getClearDepthBuffer()

      • getClearDepthBuffer

        java.nio.FloatBuffer getClearDepthBuffer()
        Gets the value to clear the depth buffer as a FloatBuffer.
        Returns:
        A FloatBuffer with a scalar value in the [0, 1] range.
        See Also:
        getClearDepth()
